meanings.definition: A severe headache or other aftereffects caused by drinking an excess of alcohol.
meanings.sent1: After the party, I woke up with a terrible hangover.
meanings.sent2: She had a hangover after drinking too much at the bar.
meanings.sent3: His hangover was a reminder to drink responsibly next time.
meanings.sent4: The hangover from last night's celebration lingered throughout the day.
meanings.sent5: The pounding headache was a classic sign of a hangover.

meanings.definition: A letdown, as after a period of excitement.
meanings.sent1: The feeling of disappointment was like a hangover from the thrilling concert.
meanings.sent2: Winning the game was amazing, but the hangover came when they lost the next one.
meanings.sent3: The hangover of defeat was hard to shake off.
meanings.sent4: The hangover of joy slowly faded as reality set in.
meanings.sent5: The hangover of anticipation left them feeling deflated.

meanings.definition: Something remaining behind from a former period or state of affairs.
meanings.sent1: The old building was a hangover from a time long gone.
meanings.sent2: The tradition was a hangover from their ancestors.
meanings.sent3: The outdated policy felt like a hangover from a different era.
meanings.sent4: The relic was a hangover of the past, reminding them of history.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned factory stood as a hangover of industrialization.
